sentence.text: She marched into the hall and flung the front door open .
Meredith flung him an eager glance , enthralled by the noise , the snow , the funereal gondolas bobbing in the water .
She flung him a savage little smile .
With a sob , Theda flung her arms about his neck and buried her face in his shoulder .
Blanche flung herself across the floor and rolled on to his feet , at the same time throwing a punch up into his genitals .
She picked a saucepan off the cooker and raised it high , as if she might fling it across the kitchen like a hatchet .
And this , " he pulled Lazlo 's map from his pocket and flung it across the table , ` The great detective left this behind when he and Rex fled from his office last night .
Her shadow jumped away from her and flung itself upwards across the walls as her candle flame wavered .
One of the group then grabbed the boy and flung him against a wall .
I was standing at one of the windows of the outer office , watching the rain fling itself remorselessly against the panes .
Robbie screamed and flung herself against the protective width of Fen 's chest .
Kate flung her arms around him and wept for joy .
She flung herself from her horse and smothered the burning body with her black cloak .
Do not fling me from your house
Milton flung himself in his chair and buried his head in his hands .
Then , in the very same breath , she snatched up the toppled coffee-cup and flung the lukewarm contents in his face .
When he came round , they dragged him outside and flung him in his night-clothes , into a car and handcuffed him .
Young Jack flung his darts in such rapid succession that they were nothing more than a triple blur .
The last word was a terrible scream and as she screamed it she flung the glass in the direction of Eddie although I 'm pretty sure she was n't aiming at anyone in particular .
Barton scooped up all the bits of paper and flung them into the air .
Suddenly they all surged towards me and flung their coins into the canvas sheet I was guarding and one old codger decided to go home .
He unzipped his black jacket and flung it on a chair .
Ranulf thought of the Lady Agnes and moaned ; she had proved a fiery lover from the time he had first flung her on her back and lifted her lace-trimmed skirts .
The customers in return sneered at the clothing offered to them , and flung it on the ground .
He flung the helmet on the ground and Philip grabbed it .
In we would climb , rolling up hats and coats and flinging them onto the back seat .
The men flung a net over me .
Another dealer owed a few hundred pounds by the director of a firm he had just left , drove one night with some friends to his house , where they flung bricks through every window .
With that he snatched up the bottle and flung it through the open window into the yard .
Balberith ripped the remains of the fruit and salad bar from its mountings and flung it through the roof .
She flung herself to the floor and rolled to safety behind the half-opened door , the Beretta clenched tightly in her gloved hand .
` Oh , yer swine , " breathed the young woman as he flung the handbag to the ground .
She flung the tape at him .
Flavia flung herself out of the room .
With hardly a glance towards the board , he flung his darts .
I felt like flinging aside the towel .
With an angry , violent gesture he flung aside the broken piece of door .
She felt as though flung from health to illness and back by the day , by the hour .
Galileo was less successful in explaining why loose objects are not flung from the surface of a spinning earth .
One of them picked up the rolled newspaper which Clasper had flung into the crowd .
She felt as if she 'd just escaped a raging tornado , flung to one side just in time .
The room was full of the cheerful clutter of a family on holiday -- books , maps and a camera flung on to the table .
Whatever he might fling at her this time , she would not sit bowed and tongue-tied .
The Colonel was flung back against the wall where he stood , for a moment , a puzzled expression on his face .
At that moment the door was flung back , thumping against the wall .
The force of the casual blow was such that Yet was flung back against a bookcase .
Chris had to hold on to the grab handle of the jeep or she would have been flung out .
The last of the mercenaries were running , flinging away their weapons as they went .
Air the bed by flinging back the covers for around half an hour every morning
The slender figure rose from the chair , and flung back its veil .
Finn flung down his paintbrush .
Denis flung down his gun in disgust .
Helen flung down her knife .
Angus and Sawney flung down their weapons .
Amanda flung off her coat in the hall and walked briskly into the lounge .
Flinging off her dressing-gown , she climbed back into the now cold bed and snuggled beneath the covers .
Lucy paced , rampaged , flung out scads of unrequited ire , impassioned as Jay had never seen her .
He flung out a hand oratorically .
He kicked it open and flung me down the three steps into the street .
With a final contemptuous glance she lifted the calliper by its straps and flung it over the small cliff .
The specks of dust consisting of heavier particles flung off by the Sun aggregate into larger lumps ( a process which can be duplicated in a laboratory ) .
She was carried up and flung outward .
